response.original_title: Can't Jail the Revolution and Break the Walls Down
response.overview: These two 30 minute videos use footage compiled from over 40 social justice media productions to chronicle the perspectives of political prisoners and of war within the United States. Historical footage is combined with interviews of activists from revolutionary movements waged by African Americans, Puerto Ricans, Native Americans and Whites against oppression. The prisoners, victims of government-sponsored attacks on liberation movements in the United States and its colonies, discuss how they and their companions have been murdered, forced underground, driven into exile and unjustly imprisoned since the late 60s.
response.tagline: Two videos use footage compiled from over 40 social justice media productions to chronicle the perspectives of political prisoners and war within the United States.
response.title: Can't Jail the Revolution and Break the Walls Down
